description: Gets a Databricks log delivery configuration object for an account, both specified by ID.

account_id.description: The Databricks account ID that hosts the log delivery configuration.

creation_time.description: Time in epoch milliseconds when the log delivery configuration was created.

update_time.description: Time in epoch milliseconds when the log delivery configuration was updated.

config_name.description: The optional human-readable name of the log delivery configuration. Defaults to empty.

ENABLED | DISABLED.description: Status of log delivery configuration. Set to

ENABLED.description: later. Deletion of a configuration is not supported, so disable a log delivery configuration that is no longer needed.

BILLABLE_USAGE | AUDIT_LOGS.description: Log delivery type. Supported values are:

BILLABLE_USAGE.description: logs are not available for usage before March 2019 (

workspace_ids_filter.description: Optional filter that specifies workspace IDs to deliver logs for. By default the workspace filter is empty and log delivery applies at the account level, delivering workspace-level logs for all workspaces in your account, plus account level logs. You can optionally set this field to an array of workspace IDs (each one is an

int64.description: For some types of Databricks deployments there is only one workspace per account ID, so this field is unnecessary.

delivery_path_prefix.description: The optional delivery path prefix within Amazon S3 storage. Defaults to empty, which means that logs are delivered to the root of the bucket. This must be a valid S3 object key. This must not start or end with a slash character.

YYYY-MM.description: format. Defaults to current year and month.

401.description: The request does not have valid authentication credentials for the operation.
